subject: Business
title: The Foot-in-the-Door Technique
description: Learn The Foot-in-the-Door Technique in one minute.

hook.text: Researchers asked people to put a tiny 'Drive Safely' sticker on their window.

buildup.text: The foot-in-the-door technique starts with a small request that leads to a bigger one.

discovery.text: Once someone says 'yes' to a small ask, they see themselves as the kind of person who says yes. Consistency kicks in.

twist.text: Free trials exploit this: once you're using the product, canceling feels like a bigger decision than subscribing did.

climax.text: 'Sign up for free' â†’ 'Try premium for $1' â†’ 'Subscribe for $29/month.' Each step feels small.

punchline.text: Small yeses lead to big commitments. Start tiny.

quiz.question: Why does the foot-in-the-door technique work?
options: People want to stay consistent with their previous commitments
People forget they already said yes
